item.title: Citadel 将向客户返还 50 亿美元对冲基金利润
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）的 Citadel 公司将返还今年赚取的约 50 亿美元利润，使其管理的资产达到 670 亿美元。【原文：Ken Griffin’s Citadel will return about $5 billion of profits earned this year, bringing its assets under management to $67 billion, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特朗普突击检查 ICE 减少了加州特许学校的债务收入
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统打击移民活动的背景下，加州一所特许学校的招生人数出现下滑，而该校大部分是西班牙裔学生，因此该特许学校的运营者请求允许其在支付债券所需的资金缓冲方面有所欠缺。【原文：A California charter school operator has asked for permission to fall short of a financial cushion required to cover its bond payments after enrollment slid at its mostly Hispanic campuses amid President Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown.】

item.title: 土耳其将最低工资提高 27%，符合预期
item.description: 土耳其将明年的最低工资上调了 27%，与市场预期基本一致，这表明政策制定者仍致力于为通胀降温。【原文：Turkey increased the minimum wage for next year by 27%, broadly in line with market expectations, in a sign policymakers remain committed to cooling inflation.】

item.title: 双线警告发达经济体 "酝酿碰撞
item.description: 从法国、英国到日本，各国政府都在努力平衡社会需求与不断膨胀的财政赤字之间的关系，因此，DoubleLine 公司警告说，一些发达经济体正在 "酝酿一场碰撞"。【原文：DoubleLine is warning of a “brewing collision” in some developed economies as governments from France to the UK and Japan struggle to balance social demands against ballooning fiscal deficits.】

item.title: 贝森特认为美联储 2% 通胀目标未来仍有修改空间
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）支持这样的观点，即一旦美国可持续地将物价上涨速度回落到 2% 的水平，就应重新考虑美联储 2% 的通胀目标。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent backed the idea of reconsidering the Federal Reserve’s 2% inflation target once the US has sustainably brought price increases back down to that pace.】

item.title: KKR 支持的 FiberCop 指控意大利机构偏袒竞争对手
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，KKR & Co.支持的 FiberCop SpA 公司已向意大利宽带机构提出法律挑战，声称该机构在意大利近 40 亿欧元（47 亿美元）的光纤铺设项目中给予了其主要竞争对手特殊待遇。【原文：KKR & Co.-backed FiberCop SpA has filed a legal challenge to Italy’s broadband agency, claiming it gave special treatment to its main rival in the nation’s near-€4 billion ($4.7 billion) fiber rollout, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国消费者信心指数连续第五个月下降
item.description: 由于对劳动力市场和商业条件的看法更加悲观，美国消费者信心连续第五个月下降。【原文：US consumer confidence declined for a fifth consecutive month on more pessimistic views of the labor market and business conditions.】

item.title: 婴儿潮一代的老龄化重振受 Covid 影响的老年住房行业
item.description: 婴儿潮一代的老龄化正在推动老年生活行业的发展，而就在几年前，Covid-19 大流行病曾导致近 100 家由市政债券资助的养老机构陷入违约。【原文：Aging baby boomers are boosting the senior living sector, just a few years after the Covid-19 pandemic pushed almost 100 facilities funded by municipal bonds into default.】

item.title: 特朗普与习近平停战之际，美国暂缓对中国芯片征收新关税
item.description: 美国指责中国在半导体领域采取不公平贸易做法，但拒绝对芯片进口征收额外关税，至少要等到 2027 年年中。【原文：The US accused China of engaging in unfair trade practices in the semiconductor sector, but is declining to impose additional tariffs on chip imports until at least mid-2027.】

item.title: 塞内加尔延长 7.19 亿美元本币债券的销售期限
item.description: 此次发行的牵头安排人 Invictus Capital & Finance SA 在 Linkedin 上发帖称，塞内加尔已将 4000 亿非洲法郎（约合 7.19 亿美元）主权债券的截止日期推迟数日。【原文：Senegal has pushed back the closing date for a 400 billion CFA francs ($719 million) sovereign bond by several days, the lead arranger for the offering Invictus Capital & Finance SA said in a Linkedin post.】

item.title: 经济数据强劲，降息希望渺茫，美国股市徘徊不前
item.description: 周二开盘时，由于交易员们正在评估美国经济以两年来最快的速度增长是否会推迟或阻止美联储的进一步降息，股市在努力寻找方向。【原文：Stocks struggled for direction at Tuesday’s open as traders assess whether the US economy growing at its fastest pace in two years would delay or stall additional Federal Reserve interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 美国国内生产总值实现两年来最快增长，国债下跌
item.description: 在数据显示美国经济以两年来最快的速度扩张，削弱了对 2026 年降息的预期之后，国债走低。【原文：Treasuries edged lower after data showed the US economy expanded at the fastest pace in two years, denting expectations for interest-rate cuts in 2026.】

item.title: 印度央行行长预计印度将面临 "长期低政策利率 "时期
item.description: 印度储备银行行长桑贾伊-马尔霍特拉（Sanjay Malhotra）表示，只要通胀保持良好态势，经济不受重大供应冲击，印度就有可能长期保持低政策利率。【原文：Reserve Bank of India Governor Sanjay Malhotra said India is likely to remain in a prolonged period of low policy rates as long as inflation stays benign and the economy is not hit by a major supply-side shock.】

item.title: ServiceNow Agrees to Buy Cyber Startup Armis for $7.75 Billion
item.description: ServiceNow Inc. has reached a deal to buy the cybersecurity startup Armis in a deal valued at $7.75 billion, representing its largest acquisition to date.

item.title: ETF狂热达到顶峰？流动、发行和交易量打破所有记录
item.description: 还有不到两周的时间，2025 年将成为价值 13 万亿美元的美国交易所交易基金行业创纪录的一年：流量、发行量和交易量都将创下新高。至于未来几年是否会如此，还有待商榷。【原文：With less than two weeks to go, 2025 is set to be a record-breaking year for the $13 trillion US exchange-traded fund industry: new high-water marks in flows, launches and trading volume. It’s up for debate whether the next few years will be as kind.】

item.title: Naspers Chair’s Trust Sells $150 Million Shares to Build Hotels
item.description: A family trust linked to South African tycoon Koos Bekker sold 2.5 billion rand ($150 million) of Naspers Ltd. shares to finance the construction of hotels in South Africa, the UK and Italy.

item.title: Canada Economy Grew in November Following October Dip
item.description: The Canadian economy continues to display resilience despite US tariffs, with initial estimates showing a small expansion last month.

item.title: AI Funding to Drive Record Year for Top-Rated Company Bond Sales
item.description: Companies across the US and Europe are preparing to sell a record amount of high-grade bonds in 2026, testing investors’ appetite as yields drift lower.

item.title: Colombia Declares ‘Economic Emergency’ After Tax Rises Nixed
item.description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro declared an ‘economic emergency’ after congress blocked his attempt to raise taxes.

item.title: US Economy Expands at Fastest Pace in Years With 4.3% GDP Gain
item.description: The US economy expanded in the third quarter at the fastest pace in two years, bolstered by resilient consumer and business spending and calmer trade policies.

item.title: Russia Moves to Legalize Domestic Crypto Deals for Retail Buyers
item.description: Russia’s central bank has prepared a framework to regulate cryptocurrencies on the domestic market that will allow retail investors to buy them in addition to qualified investors, in a fresh sign of how sanctions have reshaped its approach to the assets.

item.title: Argentina Will ‘Try Not to’ Sell Bonds in January, Caputo Says
item.description: Argentina wants to avoid selling bonds under New York law in January, Economy Minister Luis Caputo said on X, as anticipation for the country’s comeback to international debt markets continues to mount.

item.title: 亚洲油轮堵塞情况加剧，俄罗斯海上滞留石油激增
item.description:
自 8 月底以来，水面上的俄罗斯石油数量增加了近 50%

。【原文：

The amount of Russian oil on the water has swelled by almost 50% since the end of August

】

item.title: 日元疲软为何会引发政府干预
item.description: 货币市场已经做好准备，应对日本政府可能采取的干预措施，以支撑疲软的日元。2025 年以来的贬值使进口更加昂贵，并推高了家庭成本。【原文：Currency markets have been braced for a possible intervention by the Japanese government to prop up a weak yen. The depreciation over the course of 2025 has made imports more expensive and pushed up households’ costs.】

item.title: 波兰寻求加入二十国集团为东欧发声
item.description: 波兰财政部长安杰伊-多曼斯基（Andrzej Domanski）表示，波兰希望成为世界最大经济体俱乐部--20 国集团（Group of 20）的常任理事国，以帮助代表生活水平迅速提高后充满活力的东欧。【原文：Poland seeks to become a permanent member in the Group of 20 — a club of the world’s biggest economies — to help represent dynamic Eastern Europe after a speedy advance in living standards, according to Finance Minister Andrzej Domanski.】

item.title: 美国石油制裁对俄罗斯的伤害还能持续多久？
item.description: 上周，乌拉尔原油出口价跌至每桶约 34 美元，与国际基准相比大打折扣。【原文：Urals crude tumbled to about $34 a barrel at the point of export last week, a deep discount to international benchmarks.】

item.title: 墨西哥年度通胀放缓，支持墨西哥银行下调关键利率
item.description: 本月早些时候，墨西哥的年度通胀率有所放缓，支持了墨西哥中央银行因预期物价压力减弱而延长降息周期的最新决定。【原文：Mexico’s annual inflation slowed earlier this month, supporting the central bank’s latest decision to extend its cycle of interest rate cuts in anticipation of weaker price pressures.】

item.title: 巴西通胀率走低，投资者期待开始降息
item.description: 本月早些时候，巴西的年度通胀率放缓，符合预期，投资者正在思考央行行长们多久会开始放松其超紧货币政策。【原文：Brazil’s annual inflation slowed in line with expectations earlier this month as investors ponder how soon central bankers will start unwinding their ultra-tight monetary policy.】

item.title: India’s RBI to Inject $32 Billion Via Fresh Bond Buys, Swap
item.description: India’s central bank announced fresh measures aimed at boosting banking liquidity, including government bond purchases and a foreign-exchange swap.

item.title: 农民反弹后斯塔默在遗产税问题上有所退缩
item.description: 基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）领导的工党政府已将农业财产遗产税的起征点从 100 万英镑（140 万美元）提高到 250 万英镑，这是在与英国农民的长期争斗中做出的重大让步。【原文：Keir Starmer’s Labour government has raised the threshold for inheritance tax on agricultural property from £1 million ($1.4 million) to £2.5 million, a major concession in a long-running battle with British farmers.】
